intro: Miconia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian miconia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white bracts. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree in humid, shaded environments. It produces small, clustered flowers that are followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. Miconia ecuadorensis is known for its rapid growth and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive.
